com.kuka.device

Interface IKinematicsCalculator


  • public interface IKinematicsCalculator
    Interface for kinematics calculation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.kuka.device.common.Pose getForwardKinematics(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition joints, com.kuka.geometry.LoadData loadData)
      Calculates the Pose of the robot for the given joint position (forward kinematics).
      com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getInverseKinematics(com.kuka.math.geometry.ITransformation trafo, com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition referenceJointPosition, com.kuka.geometry.LoadData loadData)
      Calculates the JointPosition value of the given transformation between the foot and flange of the robot (inverse kinematics).
      com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getInverseKinematicsFromFrameAndRedundancy(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frame, com.kuka.geometry.LoadData loadData)
      Calculates the JointPosition value of the given frame under the flange of the robot (inverse kinematics).

    • Method Detail

      • getInverseKinematicsFromFrameAndRedundancy

        com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getInverseKinematicsFromFrameAndRedundancy(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frame,
                                                                                com.kuka.geometry.LoadData loadData)
        Calculates the JointPosition value of the given frame under the flange of the robot (inverse kinematics).
        Parameters:
        frame - The frame for which the inverse kinematics is requested.
        loadData - Description of load attached to the flange. This load data is used in the kinematics calculation. However, it only has an effect if absolute accuracy is available for this robot.
        Returns:
        The result of the calculation from the controller.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified frame does not contain redundancy information

      • getInverseKinematics

        com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getInverseKinematics(com.kuka.math.geometry.ITransformation trafo,
                                                          com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition referenceJointPosition,
                                                          com.kuka.geometry.LoadData loadData)
        Calculates the JointPosition value of the given transformation between the foot and flange of the robot (inverse kinematics).
        Parameters:
        trafo - The transformation root -> flange of the robot for which the inverse kinematics is requested.
        referenceJointPosition - The optional reference joint position. If there are multiple solutions, the solution closest to this reference position is returned. If referenceJointPosition is not given the current measured joint position is used.
        loadData - Description of load attached to the flange. This load data is used in the kinematics calculation. However, it only has an effect if absolute accuracy is available for this robot.
        Returns:
        The result of the calculation from the controller.

      • getForwardKinematics

        com.kuka.device.common.Pose getForwardKinematics(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition joints,
                                                 com.kuka.geometry.LoadData loadData)
        Calculates the Pose of the robot for the given joint position (forward kinematics).
        Parameters:
        joints - The joint position for which the forward kinematics calculation is requested.
        loadData - Description of load attached to the flange. This load data is used in the kinematics calculation. However, it only has an effect if absolute accuracy is available for this robot IAbsoluteAccuracy.isAbsoluteAccuracyEnabled().
        Returns:
        Pose of the robot corresponding to the given joint position. Transformations in the returned Pose object are the coordinate system of the foot of the robot (SpatialObject.getRootFrame())
